questionTitle:
Which of the following architecture is shown in the following figure?
Service Oriented Modelling practice
Modelling Environments
Modelling Solutions
Best Practices
questionExplanation: A service in SOMF that is granular and very narrow in scope is referred to as an atomic service.

questionOption1: The service object is a container where the service resides
questionOption2: The port or endpoint is the unique address of the service
questionOption3: The message content is the data and metadata that the service operation is performed on
questionExplanation: Each message may consist of one or more parts, and each part must include typing information.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the language standard for Web service interactions?
questionExplanation: BPEL is a meta-language comprised of two functions.

questionTitle: Which of the following messaging protocol is used with XML in BPEL?
questionExplanation: BPEL uses XML with specific support for messaging protocols.

questionOption1: XML schema cannot be separate files
questionOption2: A WSDL file contains essential message data for a transaction
questionOption3: A service contract codifies the relationship between the data to be processed and also the metadata that accompanies that data
questionExplanation: The XML document sets up the namespace, defines the interface, specifies the binding, names the service, provides the documentation for the service, and then supplies a schema that may be used to validate the document.

questionTitle: Which of the following topology is shown in the following figure?
questionExplanation: In star topology, every node (computer workstation or any other peripheral) is connected to a central node called a hub or switch.

questionTitle: Which of the following statement is incorrect related to BPEL?
questionOption1: Data functions in BPEL support process data and control flow
questionOption2: BPEL includes techniques for error handling and scopes transactions
questionOption3: BPEL uses Web services for standards and to assemble and decompose processes
questionExplanation: BPEL does not have a graphical component.

questionTitle: _______ is a methodology for representing business processes as a set of connected visual objects.
questionExplanation: BPMN stands for Business Process Modeling Notation.

questionTitle: Which of the following system models creates a graphical representation of software systems in the form of a set of diagram types?
questionExplanation: UML is widely used in the industry for software system modeling.

questionTitle: Which of the following topology is shown in the following figure?
questionExplanation: Hierarchical network models are iterative algorithms for creating networks which are able to reproduce the unique properties of the scale-free topology and the high clustering of the nodes at the same time.
